page.title: 01LAND N.W. OF PONTESBURY
page.content: The area of this block is rural, a wide shallow valley drained by the red brook, with the main village of Pontesbury in the south east. The buildings are of brick, with older houses and shops near the church and newer estates on the outskirts. The land, with many farms, is mainly arable, providing pasture for dairy cattle and some sheep, for which fodder crops are also grown. The scenery is undulating with hedges and matured trees, and in the north west are area of deciduous woodland, the largest being quarry woods, which shows evidence of former coppicing. On better drained land, above the permanent pasture by the brook, are the hamlets of Westley, Farley and Edge and the village of Asterley, the only settlement apart from Pontesbury to have a church and a pub.
